utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So what’d you think?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It was good.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s it? Good”

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I enjoyed it. When you told me I was going to be losing my virginity, I didn’t think you meant showing me Raiders of the Lost Ark for the first time.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My apologies. I chose my words poorly. I should have said you were about to have your world rocked on my couch. Anyway, thank you for watching it. It’s one of my all-time favourites.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It was very entertaining despite the glaring story problem.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Story problem? You, oh, Amy, what a dewy-eyed moon-calf you are. Raiders of the Lost Ark is the love child of Steven Spielberg and George Lucas, two of the most gifted filmmakers of our generation. I’ve watched it 36 times, except for the snake scene and the face-melting scene, which I can only watch when it’s still light out, but, I defy you to find a story problem. Here’s my jaw, drop it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: All right. Indiana Jones plays no role in the outcome of the story. If he weren’t in the film, it would turn out exactly the same.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I see your confusion. You don’t understand. Indiana Jones was the one in the hat with the whip.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: No, I do, and if he weren’t in the movie, the Nazis would have still found the ark, taken it to the island, opened it up and all died, just like they did. Let me close that for ya.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi. I thought you went to the comic book store on Wednesdays.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, but Sheldon and Amy were having date night and they don’t need me there to make it awkward. They have each other for that. So, how was school?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, good. Check it out, The Disappointing Child by Beverly Hofstadter.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You bought my mom’s book?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s on the recommended reading list for my psychology class.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, come on. Not that book. It, it’s got, like, every horrible story from my childhood in it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, cool. Are there pictures?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Seriously, please find another book.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, come on. Why? How bad could it be?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There, there’s chapters about potty training, and bed-wetting and masturbation. Basically, if something came out of me, she wrote about it. You know what? Do whatever you want, just don’t talk to me about it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Not even the chapter on the breast-feeding crisis?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It was not a crisis. Apparently, I favoured the left one, she got a little lopsided.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God, you still go left.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Which celebrity would you say I look like the most?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Halle Berry. Why?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Stuart and I are putting dating profiles online, and it’s one of the questions. And thank you, I’d kill for that woman’s bone structure.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why are you reading Pride and Prejudice?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll tell you why. Amy ruined Raiders of the Lost Ark for me, so now I’m trying to find something beloved to her and ruin that.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Because her life wasn’t enough?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Wait, how can, how can anyone ruin Raiders? It’s perfect.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, except for the fact that Indiana Jones is completely irrelevant to the story. With or without him, the Nazis find the ark, open it and die.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Aw!

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, wait a minute. No, the Nazis were digging in the wrong place. The only reason they got the ark was because Indy found it first.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Actually, they were only digging in the wrong place because Indy had the medallion. Without him, they would have had the medallion and dug in the right place.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Aw!

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I know you don’t want to talk about it, but can I just ask you one question about your mom’s book?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I just want to know why a five-year-old boy puts on his mom’s make-up and wears balloon boobies.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: They weren’t boobies, they were muscles. And the make-up was green. I was pretending to be The Hulk.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You were wearing her bra.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That was to keep my muscles from sagging. Can we please stop talking about this?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, okay. But you know, as a student of psychology who got a check-plus on her first homework assignment, I think, sometimes, it’s good to open up about these things.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, fine. Do you want to know why I dressed like The Hulk? Because I was always mad at my mom and I wanted to smash my way out of that house.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, why were you so angry?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Gee, I don’t know. Maybe it’s because I was always the subject of her little experiments. Did you get to the chapter where she staged the Easter egg hunt with no eggs to see how long I’d keep looking? The answer, by the way, June.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sweetie, I’m so sorry. I wish there was something I could do to make you feel better.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I do, too, but there’s not.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Really? Are you sure about that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Of course, who am I to argue with a check-plus student? Just warning you, I’m gonna go right. Don’t make a big deal out of it.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Is make-up really necessary?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, when someone looks at your dating profile, the first thing they see is your picture. I just want to make sure you look fun and full of life and not like a body they just pulled out of the river. All right, here we go, and smile. Okay, uh-uh, that one’s in the bank. How about this? Turn away, and then turn back into it. But when you do, imagine the camera is the girl you want to meet.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: You got it.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, uh, let’s try it again. Uh, but this time, pretend the girl you want to meet doesn’t want to hurt you.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I don’t think I can give you that.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Come on. One more time. Yeah, it’s, it’s a little blurry, but I think that works in your favour. Do you want a beer?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Sure. Hey, have you finished writing your profile yet?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Almost. Oh, what did you put as the one-word description of yourself?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I put unobjectionable. But now that I hear it out loud, it just seems like I’m being cocky. What did you put for your best feature?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: My parents’ money. Uh, what did you put for your best feature?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I put: not applicable.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Come on, dude, you’re being too hard on yourself. You’ve got a lot of good stuff going on.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Really? Like what?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, okay, you’re a, you’re a talented artist, you own your own business.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Neither of those things have ever helped me meet a woman.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, well, can we imply that you’re well-endowed?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I do have one oddly long testicle.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Okay, now you’re talking like a winner!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Whatcha doin’?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, it turns out Amy’s beloved Pride and Prejudice is a flawless masterpiece. He’s got too much pride, she’s got too much prejudice, it just works.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: So you’re looking to ruin something for her in the funny pages?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy has a fondness for the comic strip Marmaduke.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mm-hmm. And?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And I think I’ve got it. Consider, a family possesses a dog that is so large and poorly disciplined, he causes nothing but problems. Why do they keep him?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Maybe they fell in love with him as a puppy and didn’t know how big he was gonna be.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Of course. You know, why couldn’t she just like Ziggy? Yeah? That thing’s riddled with plot holes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Sorry, buddy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Ooh, I think she’s a fan of Garfield as well. Oh, darn it, now so am I.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ll see you later. I gotta go watch a stupid football game with Penny.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Wait, hang on. You’ve spent time with Amy. Can you think of anything she’s fond of that has a bunch of flaws she hasn’t noticed?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: You ready to go?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yep. Hey, and maybe this time you don’t try and talk sports with the guys.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Some sports bar. It’s like they never even heard of Quidditch. Do we really have to go?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, come on. Every time we’re about to hang out with my friends, you don’t want to. It’s like, It’s too loud, or the bathroom’s too dirty, or they put a chicken wing in my ear. I mean…

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, you’re, you’re right. Let’s just go.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, what’s going on with you?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Nothing, I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right, hang on. is this still about your mom’s book?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No. Not everything is about my mom.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: ‘Cause if you’re still upset about that, we don’t have to go.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Except this is totally about my mom.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I’m so sorry. I never should have read that book. You know what? You want to just get dinner and watch the game here?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That sounds nice. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Or, you know, we could get take-out and watch the Blu-ray extended version of The Hobbit movie with commentary track. On account of how sad I am about my mom.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Leonard, you ready for lunch?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: One sec. Hey. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hi, Penny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi. All right, sweetie. You hang in there today.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ll try, but I might be sad again tonight.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wow. Sex at work?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Leave it alone. That’s my girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Who just had sex with me at work.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Damn. How’d you swing that?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, whenever I talk about how awful my mom was, Penny will do anything to make me feel better.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Seriously?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look, I mean, I’m not proud of it, but it does work. I got her to watch a six-part documentary on Monty Python. Even I was bored, I just wanted to see if she’d make it to the end.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You sound kind of proud of it.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I am, I’m really proud.

utterance.speaker: Amy (on webcam)
utterance.content: Hello, Sheldon. Is everything okay?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. Why?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, the last time you made an unscheduled video-chat, there was a curly fry in your regular fries and you thought someone might be trying to slip you a mickey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: April 13, a dark night, indeed.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So what can I do for you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m calling to invite you to a spontaneous date night tomorrow evening.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. You were kind enough to watch Raiders of the Lost Ark with me. So I’d like to return the favour by inviting you to watch an episode of your favourite childhood television series, Little House on the Prairie.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That sounds lovely. Why are you rubbing your hands together?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Um, I’m putting on lotion. Are you in or not?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Of course I’m in.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Excellent. Then I shall see you tomorrow. Good night, Dr. Fowler.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Good night, Dr. Cooper.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Good night, indeed. What a rube. Why would I put on lotion when I have such soft hands?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You were really quiet during dinner. Is everything okay?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah. I guess I was just thinking about my mom, and how sad my childhood was.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, I bet it sucked. I’m gonna take a bath, you do the dishes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How about I take a bath with you and see what happens.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Here’s what’s gonna happen. I’m gonna take a bath, and you’re gonna do the dishes.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s it? No compassion?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Aw, poor Howie. We good? I’m gonna take a bath.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Bernie…

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: God, what is going on with you?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m sharing my pain.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: And I’m not buying it. Try again.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m learning to be a man in a culture where it’s increasingly difficult to know how?

utterance.speaker: Bermadette
utterance.content: Strike two.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m copying Leonard. When he does this to Penny, they have sex and watch Monty Python.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know. It was dumb, I shouldn’t have done it. And it’s making me feel sad. So sad. You know, why don’t you take a bath? I’ll do the dishes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Three, two, one.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: That’s it. Our dating profiles are live on the Internet.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Attention all shoppers, my business is open for business!

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: That’s right, ladies. For all you know, I’m confident and fun to be around.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Oh, cool, it tells you when someone’s reading your profile. Jenny309. I hope that’s not her weight.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: If it is, I’ll take her. Ooh, I got one, too. The ladies are coming to us. Oh, man, if I’d started this years ago, I’d be divorced two or three times by now.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What? Another one. You know, it, it’s weird. When they’re reading your profile, does it, does it make you feel exposed? Like they see you naked?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Well, they’re not running away screaming, so, no.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I love Little House. It made me want to live on a farm so much I tried to milk my cat. That tangy bowl of Cheerios was not worth the stitches.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, you sit back, relax and enjoy a beloved childhood memory. You see that cabin there? I read they were illegally squatting on Indian land. Yeah. Personally, I think what we did to the Native Americans was wrong, but this is your favourite show, not mine. Oh, look at little Laura Ingalls, eating that peanut butter sandwich. Peanut butter? Huh? That’s strange, since peanut butter wasn’t introduced until the early 1900s. If I knew this show was about time travel, I would have watched it much sooner.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’re trying to get back at me for what I said about Raiders of the Lost Ark.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s silly. Almost as silly as Dr. Baker having a telephone, since telephones only existed in large cities at that time. This is more like Little House on the Preposterous.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, we’re in a relationship. When you get angry, just tell me. You don’t need to seek revenge.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Are you sure? Every time my dad stayed out all night, my mom would put hamster poop in his chewing tobacco.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Well, that’s not how we’re going to do it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Fine. I’m mad at you. Not only did you ruin Raiders for me, you may have ruined the whole franchise. Except for the fourth one, which was bad before you got your mitts on it.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I shouldn’t have said it. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Do you feel better?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. But not as good as I’m going to when I tell you that your precious Garfield has no reason to hate Mondays. He’s a cat. He doesn’t have a job.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, I was just… what is happening?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, just a little treat. I know you’ve been feeling really bad about your mom lately.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, oh, I have. So bad.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And I wanted to make you feel better, so I planned something very special for you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh-huh, I can already feel it working.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Hofstadter (on webcam)
utterance.content: Hello, Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mom?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Hofstadter
utterance.content: I understand you have been whining about my parenting in order to emotionally manipulate your girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I… uh…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Bernadette told me everything. Now you don’t get the left or the right.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Hofstadter
utterance.content: Let’s discuss why you continue to involve me in your sex life.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, please, Mommy. No, Mommy.

utterance.speaker: Mrs Hofstadter
utterance.content: When you were six years old, you walked in on me and your father naked. I was swatting his bottom with your brand new Ping Pong paddle.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I didn’t dream that?

utterance.speaker: Mrs Hofstadter
utterance.content: How did that make you feel?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Penny, come back. I’m sad for real now.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: In the last two hours, 162 women have read our profiles. How many of them have sent us messages?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Combined?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Zero.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Dude, this is, this is brutal.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I don’t think I’ve ever felt so rejected. And I had a rescue dog who ran back to the pound.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: This is the worst. If we’re gonna get shot down, we might as well just go to a bar and do it old school.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: And make them look us in the eye.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, anything is better than this.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Girl
utterance.content: Not interested.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I was wrong. This is worse.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Wait, wait, if it wasn’t for Indiana Jones, the ark would never have ended up at the warehouse.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That’s true. He collected and delivered the ark to the proper authorities for filing.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Like a hero.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Although, technically, Indy was supposed to take the ark to a museum to be studied. He couldn’t even get that done.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Aw!
